means: 痉挛的，由痉挛引起的，一阵阵的

sentence.Network_en: There was spasmodic fighting in the area yesterday.
sentence.Network_cn: 昨天，那一地区发生过零星的战斗。

sentence.Network_en: He managed to stifle the spasmodic sobs of panic rising in his throat.
sentence.Network_cn: 他惊慌得差一点哭了起来，不过还是竭力地克制住了。

sentence.Network_en: My husband's work was so spasmodic.
sentence.Network_cn: 我丈夫的工作总是时忙时闲。

1．痉挛性斜颈(spasmodic torticollis) 是胸锁乳突肌等颈部肌群阵发性不自主收缩引起颈部向一侧扭转，通常30～40岁起病，女性较多。早期常为.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from modern Latin spasmodicus, from Greek spasmōdēs, from spasma (see spasm)

entry.def: Something that is spasmodic happens suddenly, for short periods of time, and at irregular intervals.

example.ex: He managed to stifle the spasmodic sobs of panic rising in his throat...
example.tran: 他惊慌得差一点哭了起来，不过还是竭力地克制住了。

example.ex: My husband's work was so spasmodic.
example.tran: 我丈夫的工作总是时忙时闲。

means.word_mean: 1. affected by involuntary jerky muscular contractions; resembling a spasm;
2. occurring in spells and often abruptly;

auth_sentence.content: The dog was eating something, jaws working in spasmodic gulps.

auth_sentence.content: The violence here is spasmodic, the passions more schematic than unchained.
